Description: Lower lip sherd with top of cul of large Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; exterior: on wall, painted decoration consisting of goat (part of snout in outline and front hoof remaining) to right; below three lines; below, part of guilloche pattern in handle zone below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Goats fall out of favour after the Wild Goat Style in circa 600BC but they do surface occasionally on later chalices, for example, British Museum 1924,1201.151 and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA72 and NA103.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1163) (phase 2)
